meanings.definition: To turn forward or tilt forward.
meanings.sent1: She decided to antevert the picture frame for a better view.
meanings.sent2: Please antevert the book so it's easier to read.
meanings.sent3: He tried to antevert the chair, but it ended up falling over!
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm seemed to antevert time itself.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to antevert the card in a surprising way.

meanings.definition: To move or position something forward.
meanings.sent1: He will antevert the chair to make more space in the room.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to antevert their desks for group work.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to antevert the toy mouse but got distracted by a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The team's strategy was to antevert their position in the market.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to antevert the leaves in a gentle dance.

meanings.definition: To place something in front of something else.
meanings.sent1: She will antevert the vase on the table for decoration.
meanings.sent2: The chef will antevert the garnish on the dish before serving.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to antevert the acorn in front of the tree.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to antevert the truth in a surprising way.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to antevert the colors on the canvas.
